articles.title: King Charles III live updates: Queen Elizabeth II's body to be moved from Balmoral to Edinburgh, Australia to hold national day of mourning - ABC News
articles.description: Anthony Albanese says King Charles III will "need to forge his own path", and that in his view it would be appropriate if he continued to advocate for issues close to his heart. Follow live.
articles.content:
King Charles has had a long-standing love affair with Australia, dating back to his school years.

articles.title: Australia's national day of mourning for Queen Elizabeth II to be public holiday - ABC News
articles.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says September 22 will be a holiday to coincide with a memorial service for the Queen.
articles.content:
Australians will get a one-off public holiday on the national day of mourning for Queen Elizabeth II later this month.

articles.title: Free public transport across NSW for King Charles’ proclamation ceremony - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: Passengers on buses, trains, ferries and light rail do not have to tap on until midnight, amid a ceremony proclaiming King Charles III as Australia’s sovereign.

Public transport will be free across NSW on Sunday to mark an official ceremony naming King Charles III as Australias sovereign.
